comments.body: Maybe what's written here is standard boilerplate, but I don't think we want to encourage people to report these kinds of serious issues by opening an issue. I think it would be better to handle these kinds of things privately (i.e. by contacting the project maintainers) rather than publicly, at least for the initial report.
Also, I agree we should put a contact email here to make this easier, rather than the ambiguous "the project maintainers."

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by
opening an issue or contacting one or more of the project maintainers.

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant

comments.body: Would it be better to replace this paragraph that says something to the effect of "the same standards described under "contributor code of conduct" also apply to Kubernetes events" ?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +45,49 @@with their employer's policies on appropriate workplace behavior.

While at Kubernetes events or related social networking opportunities, attendees should not engage in
discriminatory or offensive speech or actions regarding gender, sexuality, race, or religion. Speakers should
be especially aware of these concerns.
